newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine 20-year T-bond coupon at 14.375 pct.
newsitem.headline: Philippine 20-year T-bond coupon at 14.375 pct.

text.p: The coupon on the Philippines' maiden 20-year treasury bond was set at 14.375 percent at an auction on Tuesday, the Bureau of Treasury said.
Accepted rates ranged from a high of 14.45 to a low of 13.5 percent, with the average at 14.197 percent.
The auction was oversubscribed with 12.868 billion pesos worth of tenders, of which 2.0 billion pesos were awarded.
The coupon rate turned out to be lower than the forecast of 14.5 to 16.0 percent in a Reuters poll of five bankers hours before the auction.
"It's very successful," Finance Secretary Roberto de Ocampo told Reuters after the auction.
Government officials said the issuance of the 20-year bonds will help establish a yield curve for long-term lending in the country.
The 20-year treasury bond is considered the longest maturing government security in the region.
